name: Simon Laplace (Simon)
appearance: A lean Caucasian man with a weary expression and unkempt hair. His clothing is often mismatched and worn from constant travel, giving him the look of someone who rarely stays in one place for long.
personality: Protective, guilt-ridden, and restless. Simon shows a surprising sense of conscience despite his morally gray past. Distrustful of authority, but deeply loyal to the few people he cares about.
background: Simon was once involved in organizing escort work and fringe nightlife circles. After nearly allowing Nancy to be forced into sex work in a red-light district, he intervened at the last moment and took her away. Determined to help her quit gambling and start over, Simon chose a life on the road, traveling across the United States with Nancy. This decision caused deep dissatisfaction and conflict with Anatole, who viewed Simon’s actions as irresponsible and dangerous.
goals: Protect Nancy and help her rebuild her life
Avoid being dragged back into his former criminal connections
secrets: He knows more about underground trafficking networks than he admits
He fears that his past choices will eventually catch up with him and Nancy

clues.clueText: Nancy was nearly forced into sex work before Simon intervened and took her away.
Their constant travel was intended to escape both gambling debts and criminal retaliation.

relationships.description: Acts as her protector and caretaker.
relationships.history: Rescued her from exploitation and chose a drifting life to keep her safe.

relationships.description: Anatole disapproves of Simon’s choices and lifestyle.
relationships.history: Their relationship deteriorated after Simon took Nancy away and rejected Anatole’s plans.

notes: Simon may be reluctant to share information unless investigators convince him they pose no threat to Nancy.
